reviewText: Thank you for having this DVD movies available.  I originally watched it on Hallmark Chanel and I like this movie because it has no violence, Nudity and great as a family film.

My wife and I like watching Hallmark movies and this movie was another great one that will be coming out soon. You will get some great snafus and humorous moments. There were so many comedies of errors throughout the movie, it left me with a smile on my face and thoroughly entertained. The actors did a great job portraying their characters and making them believable and likable. Overall, this was a fun movie for the whole family!

*I received this for review - all opinions are my own*

The situations in this movie are very true to life situations that married couples find themselves dealing with. It has some comedy. I thought the characters  were okay but I found them to be somewhat annoying. It seemed their problems mostly came from them wanting only what was best for themselves and miscommunication. It was an okay movie but not one of my favriote romance movies.
It was interesting to see if they could make it through the hard times  and find out if their love would shine through or if it would all end in disaster.
It's a great hallmark movie, my only complaint is that I wish hallmark would put more of its movies on DVD like they did this one

This is a fun, somewhat humorous movie.  The premise is a good one.  While the outcome is predictable, the surprise is figuring out which couple decides what.  The best part is watching the couples' initial reactions to the unusual news and then their processes of arriving at their final decisions.  We really enjoyed the movie.  Not high powered, but fine to watch together during the evening meal.
My daughter loves this movie. I was so excited to be able to find it and give it to her for Christmas. She has watched it over and over. Thanks!

This review is really a warning for parents who look at Hallmark movies as good family fare, as I do. I know plenty of people will disagree with me, but I think this movie gives a bad portrayal of what a marriage should be like all the way around. If any couple in real life had so little communication between them as these three couples do, then they would never make it to their first anniversary.  In addition (spoiler alert), to have one of the three brides not remarry her husband after they found out their marriage certificates were not legally signed and completed, but yet she got her "happily ever after" with someone else, I don't find this to be a good family movie at all.  There was also more language than most other Hallmark movies I have seen, especially taking the Lord's name in vain. And when I got to the end of the movie, I did not have that feel-good feeling like I often do with the Hallmark movies.

This movie Nearlyweds starring Danielle Panabaker, Jessica Parker Kennedy and Britt Irvin and Naomi Judd. This movie is about three best friends, named Erin (Danielle Panabaker), Casey (Jessica Parker Kennedy) and Stella (Britt Irvin) who get married in the same month. The three girls all thought they were getting happily ever after.  One day a letter came out to all three girls saying that the three girls are not married because some important papers were not filed. When the girls first read the letters they are afraid of telling their husbands because they think they will not marry them again because there are some bumps in the road with their marriages. Watch this movie to see if Erin, Casey and Stella ever get married for real. This movie is really cute! I hope you enjoy it!!
Relaxing movie  when I don't want to have to keep track of plot, etc.  mindless entertainment

Cute, fun movie. Liked the cast. Sad that the dog girl gave up a very gorgeous husband. I tried to understand. That is okay though. Garage sale lady got him now. Bad guy on When calls the heart. Cute dog. Nasty habits though. Good ending. 3 females wed then learn their marriage certificates were never signed. They all were experiencing conflict in their marriage. Jealousy, mother-in-law issues. A contriving husband.....on and on making for a temptation to stay unmarried. watch the rest yourself and enjoy!!
